title: Trademark Fundamentals
description: A fast breakdown of Trademark Fundamentals for builders.

hook.text: The Nike swoosh is worth billions. It's not the design that's valuableâ€”it's what customers associate with it.

buildup.text: A trademark is a word, symbol, or design that identifies the source of goods and distinguishes them from others.

discovery.text: Trademark rights come from use, not registration. Using a distinctive mark in commerce creates common law rights.

twist.text: USPTO registration provides stronger protection: nationwide priority, legal presumptions, and federal court access.

climax.text: Unlike patents and copyrights, trademarks can last foreverâ€”as long as they're used and defended.

punchline.text: A trademark doesn't protect the product. It protects the reputation.

quiz.question: How long can a trademark last?
options: Life of the owner plus 70 years
